TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HttpBrowserCapabilitiesWrapper extends System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that enables the server to gather information about the capabilities of the browser that has made the current request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> class and serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class. This class exposes the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class and exposes the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> type. The <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilitiesBase> class enables you to replace the original implementation of the <xref:System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities> class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities httpBrowserCapabilities) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that this wrapper class provides access to.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property VBScript As Boolean
public: virtual property bool VBScript { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the browser supports Visual Basic Scripting edition (VBScript).
Docs.value:
if the browser supports VBScript; otherwise, . The default is .
This property does not indicate whether VBScript is currently enabled in the browser, only whether the browser can support VBScript.
